quotes.quote: Being homosexual doesn't determine a man's whole character any more than being heterosexual does.
Being gay is not a Western invention. It is a human reality.
HomosexualityÂ is God's way of insuring that the truly gifted aren't burdened with children.
The heterosexuality or homosexuality of many individuals is not an all-or-none proposition.
Homosexuality was invented by a straight world dealing with its own bisexuality.
Disapproval ofÂ homosexualityÂ cannot justify invading the houses, hearts and minds of citizens who choose to live their lives differently.
Homosexuality is immutable, irreversible and nonpathological.
There was nothing abnormal about it when homosexuality was the norm.
In itself,Â homosexualityÂ is as limiting as heterosexuality: The ideal should be to be capable of loving a woman or a man; either, a human being, without feeling fear, restraint, or obligation.
What the homosexual wants, and here he is neither willing to compromise nor morally required to compromise â€” is acceptance of homosexuality as a way of life fully on a par with heterosexuality.
In homosexual love the passion is homosexuality itself. What a homosexual loves, as if it were his lover, his country, his art, his land, is homosexuality.
As long as society is anti-gay, then it will seem like being gay is anti-social.
Homosexuality is like the weather. It just is.
Homosexuality is neither a sin, nor an anomaly or a disease. It is an evolutionary variation.
Homosexuality, like androgyny, might be an instinctive racial response to overpopulation, crowding, and stress. Both flourish when empire reaches its apogee.
You know, gay, lesbian, bisexual, transgender - people are people.
Homosexuality is assuredly no advantage, but it is nothing to be ashamed of, no vice, no degradation, it cannot be classified as an illness.
It's funny that they've called homosexuality a crime. At this rate, everyone will be a criminal.
If you removed all of the homosexuals and homosexual influence from what is generally regarded as American culture, you would pretty much be left with "Let's Make a Deal."
From a religious point of view, if God had thoughtÂ homosexualityÂ is a sin, he would not have created gay people.
The homosexual is a scapegoat who evokes no sympathy. Hence, he can only be a victim, never a martyr.
IfÂ homosexualityÂ is a disease, let's all call in queer to work: Hello. Can't work today, still queer.
Heterosexuality is not normal, it's just common.
Homosexuality has been around since humanity began and different societies at different times have reacted in a different manner.
It is a great injustice to persecute homosexuality as a crime, and cruelty too.
There is a great deal of sin that comes from homosexuals who believe their homosexuality is a sin.
If male homosexuals are called "gay," then female homosexuals should be called "ecstatic."
If you have an issue with homosexuality, then it comes to your own fear and your own darkness.
